titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Gorham Davis Collection

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Professor of English at Columbia University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A group of literary manuscripts, including three letters written to Professor Robert Gorham Davis by Ezra Pound, the holograph draft by Dorothy Parker of her address delivered at the Esquire Magazine Symposium in October 1958, and two manuscripts of James T. Farrell, one containing holograph drafts of poems, and the other being a carbon copy typescript of various chapters from WHAT TIME COLLECTS. Also, approximately 65 letters from Ella Winter in the late 1930s, discussing politics, writing, and their social circle; approximately 25 letters from Laura Riding written in the late 1970s on language and, in particular, her book RATIONAL DEFINITION; and letters from James T. Farrell, Granville Hicks, Richard Rovere, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contained a journal kept by William McKendry from the end of 1778 to January 1780, portions of which relate to General John Sullivan's campaign against the Iroquois Indians. The journal is cataloged separately under the call number: X973.309\M196.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The colletion is arranged into three series:
Series I: Catalogued Correspondence, 1908-1976
Series II: Manuscripts, 1933-1963
Series III: Arranged Material, 1932-1978

custodhist.p: Gift of Robert G. Davis, 1965 and 1983.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Robert Gorham Davis Collection; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Librarian for Rare Books and Manuscripts.
